events.title: Battle of Saratoga Begins
events.description: The Battle of Saratoga, a key turning point in the American Revolutionary War, began with American forces engaging British troops in New York.
events.significance: This battle led to the surrender of British General Burgoyne and helped secure French support for the American cause.

events.title: Chester A. Arthur Becomes U.S. President
events.description: Following the assassination of President James A. Garfield, Vice President Chester A. Arthur was sworn in as the 21st President of the United States.
events.significance: Arthur's presidency marked important civil service reforms, including the Pendleton Civil Service Reform Act.

events.title: New Zealand Grants Women Right to Vote
events.description: New Zealand became the first self-governing country to grant all women the right to vote in parliamentary elections.
events.significance: This was a milestone in the global women's suffrage movement and women's rights.

events.title: The Mau Mau Uprising Begins
events.description: The Mau Mau rebellion against British colonial rule in Kenya officially began with an oath-taking ceremony by the Kikuyu people.
events.significance: This uprising was pivotal in Kenya's struggle for independence, which was achieved in 1963.

events.title: First Gulf War Ends
events.description: The United Nations announced a ceasefire effectively ending combat in the Gulf War after coalition forces expelled Iraqi troops from Kuwait.
events.significance: The war reshaped Middle Eastern geopolitics and demonstrated new military technologies in warfare.
